description: From Middle English water cresse, water-kresse, watercrasse, water cars, equivalent to water +‎ cress. Cognate with West Frisian waterkers (“watercress”), Dutch waterkers (“watercress”), Swedish vattenkrasse (“watercress”).

entries.meaning: A perennial European herb, Nasturtium officinale, that grows in freshwater streams; used in salads and as a garnish.
